content:
Ciao, anzitutto due domande:

  1. l'account è di tipo IMAP o POP3?
  2. accedi allo stesso account anche da altre posizioni (webmail, app, smartphone, etc.)?

Intanto come misura di emergenza, fai una copia delle email che rischiano di essere cancellate: Tieni premuto il tasto Ctrl sulla tastiera e trascina i messaggi in una sottocartella di Cartelle locali (eventualmente creala appositamente)
creator: @next

content:
Ciao, 1. è un account IMAP 2. accedo allo stesso account da un secondo PC, sempre con Thunderbird, e lì le mail non spariscono

Grazie intanto per la misura d'emergenza
creator: desireedandrea

content:
Per gli account IMAP devi andare in menu > impostazioni account > NOME_ACCOUNT > sincronizzazione e archiviazione

qui: a) assicurati che la voce Conserva in questo computer i messaggi di qualunque cartella di questo account sia spuntata b) assicurati che in Spazio su disco sia attiva la voce Sincronizza in locale i messaggi di qualunque età c) più in basso controlla che siano attive le voci Non eliminare alcun messaggio e Conserva sempre i messaggi speciali

Altre 3 domande nell'eventualità che il problema persista:

  1. Sul secondo PC l'account è sempre configurato come IMAP?
  2. Sul server i messaggi sono ancora presenti?
  3. Di che provider email si tratta?
creator: @next

content:
Ciao,

ho verificato i punti a), b) e c) e confermo che fossero tutti settati correttamente.

Per le altre tre domande: 1. ho controllato il secondo PC e mi sono accorta che lì l'account era configurato come POP3 (con attiva l'opzione di mantenere i messaggi anche sul server senza scadenza). Ho copiato localmente tutte le mail, eliminato l'account e l'ho ricreato IMAP 2. i messaggi spariti non sono nemmeno sul server 3. la mail è su host.it

Il problema potrebbe essere questo. La coesistenza di accessi POP ed accessi IMAP per una stessa casella è problematica.

content: I suggest highlighting the account on left sidebar in main view, rightclick and select 'subscribe' to see what folders you are subscribed to. I recommend NOT subscribing to folders not need by you, specifically AllMail. Allmail is ok, but is a duplicate of your messages, increase disk space, and often causes confusion.

content:
Používate IMAP prístup k pošte. Thunderbird je v tomto prípade iba takým zrkadlom. Keď spred zrkadla odstránite nejaký predmet, tak ho v zrkadle už neuvidíte. Thunderbird v IMAP prístupe k pošte zobrazuje presne to, čo je na poštovom servery. Ako z toho von? - archívovať, archívovať a archívovať - do priečinka na počítači - najlepšie do "Lokálnych priečinkov". V takomto prípade sa vám každá archívovaná pošta ukladá do počítača a v počítači bude dovtedy, pokiaľ ju sám neodstránite.

Jednoduchšie je pristupovať k pošte protokolom POP. V takomto prípade sa vám každá prijatá pošta automaticky ukladá do vášho počítača a v počítači bude dovtedy, pokiaľ ju sám neodstránite. Ak odstránite všetku starú poštu ktorá je na poštovom servery, tak bude odstránená iba zo servera. Vo vašom počítači zostáva všetka pošty.

Odporúčam "smazane zprávy na poštovním serveru" pohľadať ešte v koši na poštovom serveri.
creator: Ansamb

content: My guess is you have more than one email address and are using the same SMTP server for both. verify by going to account settings, scroll down left side to 'Outgoing server (SMTP) and view the SMTP servers. There must be one for each account and have the email address specified and a unique Description field for each. Once you do that, revisit the account pane for each and adjust the bottom line that shows SMTP server and verify that it points to the one for that account.
creator: davidsk

content: To clarify, you are sending from email address A and using the SMTP server for email address B.
creator: davidsk

content: I agree that's a good guess, but I only have one email and only that one choice for the outgoing server.

content: Hola, Claro subiendo A, se reduce el tamaño de D dejando mas espacio para la lectura de mensajes, también en el menú VER->Densidad->Compacto reduce el espaciado en la lista de mensajes (espacio D) entrando mas mensajes en el mismo espacio entonces te permitiría subir mas A, tambien puedes modificar el tamaño de la letra o usar el zoom, o directamente cambiar a vista vertical, en resumen son las opciones que tienes en el menú VER, otras o mas modificaciones visuales ya necesitan agregar archivos con programación de HTML CSS al Thunderbird hay foros dedicados a esto, pero no es soportado oficialmente. Saludos

content:
For us to better investigate this issue, we will need some more information.

Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX
creator: MattAuSupport

I've noticed something since posting that may help. When I open my inbox, I often see these previously deleted message showing up in the "read" status. If I click the "Get Messages" icon next to my mailbox name, the Inbox will clean up these stale copies. However, if I close and reopen Thunderbird, the stale copies of the emails will be back again. Clicking "Get Messages" cleans them up and this persists until I close Thunderbird. The same issue occurs when running in troubleshooting mode.
creator: ou3lyf7j

content:
Try right clicking the folder, selecting properties and then the repair button. Hopefully that will fix the issue.

Second, you have what appear to be lots of old printers in Thunderbird profile. go down to the printers section in the troubleshooting information and click clear saved print settings.

Mostly undocumented search in Troubleshooting Press Ctrl+F to open search on page. Type in search term print and press the down arrow on right of the term a couple of times to be navigated to the printer section.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I just wanted to note that the Repair folder option works, but is not persistent. It copies of previously synced messages from the Inbox and Junk folders that have been deleted or stored offline in Personal folders. However, after a few days, they start reappearing and I have to repair the folders again. I'm wondering if the issue lies in the IMAP implementation of the Charter/Spectrum/Roadrunner mail server rather than Thunderbird?
creator: ou3lyf7j

content:
I'd like to add to this issue since I seem to be having a similar problem.

When I delete an email and it goes to the Trash folder it may or may not get deleted on the email server. I have the email accounts set up as IMAP, so everything should sync. I get a lot of spam so I stay on top of the trash folders, deleting them a couple of times a day. A week or so ago I noticed that the trash emails I was deleting had delivery dates up to 5 or 6 days ago; very odd. I am able to go to my account online, using my ISP's (Spectrum) online email access and see/delete the old emails and they don't return.

Today, in TB, I deleted 4 emails from one of my email accounts' Inbox. They went to the Trash folder in TB, Spectrum email access and visible in my Outlook 2013 email app. I deleted 1 email in TB and the email disappeared from the other 2 places; Spectrum and Outlook 2013. I waited about 5 minutes and deleted a second email from the TB Trash folder. It has been over an hour now and on both Spectrum and Outlook 2013 there are 3 files in the Trash folder but TB has only 2.

I deleted 2 more emails in the TB Trash that have stayed on the Spectrum email server and in my Outlook 2013 email app. But then I delete them on the Spectrum server and they stayed in the Outlook 2013. There should be only 1 email left in the Trash folder for all of the locations, but that's not how it is. (Note: A spam email arrived as I was deleting files, so the total was 5 emails.)

Now I'm confused because it seems like there is a disconnect somewhere but I can't point the finger at anyone, although I still think it's Spectrum. If I delete it from Spectrum and it doesn't delete anywhere else and I delete it from TB and it doesn't (always) delete it from Spectrum then I think that is where the problem is, especially since, for me, it all started about 2 weeks ago.

It appears to me that the IMAP sync is not always working properly.
creator: rich.ward

content: Copying to IMAP is problematic, not because of Thunderbird, but it's part of the IMAP architecture. If you need to do that, I suggest copying a few messages at a time. How many you can do may vary.

content: I am a consistent user of having message sorted from oldest (at the top) to newest (at the bottom). I am not seeing what you are reporting. However, if you have sorted newest to oldest, then deleting a message does move next to an older message, not newer.
creator: wsmwk

content: Toggle mail.delete_matches_sort_order to true in Settings/General/Config. editor and see if it achieves the effect you're looking for.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Wayne Mery said
I am a consistent user of having message sorted from oldest (at the top) to newest (at the bottom). I am not seeing what you are reporting. However, if you have sorted newest to oldest, then deleting a message does move next to an older message, not newer.

Unfortunately, you misunderstood my query. I have newest at the top, as that is what I am used to with Mac Mail; but when I delete a message, the highlight moves down to the next oldest one. I want it to move up to the next newest one.

content:
The Hotmail settings are shown here. But the main problem is that the optus account is trying to send on the hotmail smtp. You should also have an optus smtp with these settings:

mail.optusnet.com.au, port 25, security=none, authentication = password, transmitted insecurely, User Name = part of address before the @.

https://www.optus.com.au/for-you/support/answer?id=1434
